subject: Sales
title: The Power of the Pause
description: Learn The Power of the Pause in one minute.

hook.text: Obama paused mid-sentence during speeches. The silence made thousands of people lean forward waiting.

buildup.text: Pauses give audiences time to absorb, anticipate, and feel the weight of what was just said.

discovery.text: A three-second pause has more impact than ten extra words. Silence is the strongest form of emphasis.

twist.text: Nervous speakers fill every gap with 'um' and 'basically.' These fillers drain all authority.

climax.text: Replace every filler word with silence. The pause makes you sound confident, never hesitant.

punchline.text: The pause is the most underrated tool in any pitch.

quiz.question: Why are pauses powerful in public speaking?
options: They give audiences time to absorb and create emphasis
They make the speaker look confused
